_2: Some of these settings are safe, others can break your server if modified incorrectly
_3: New settings/defaults won't appear automatically on this file when upgrading.

settings._3: Whether to send all strings translated to server locale or let the device handle them
settings._5: Show a console message when a plugin uses deprecated API methods
settings._7: If set to auto, it'll try to detect the number of cores (and at least 1)

network._1: Threshold for batching packets, in bytes. Only these packets will be compressed
network._2: Set to 0 to compress everything, minus 1 to disable.
network._3: Compression level used of Zlib when sending batched packets. Higher = more CPU, less bandwidth usage

debug._1: If > 1, it will show debug messages in the console

level_settings._1: The default format that levels will use when created
level_settings._2: Automatically change levels tick rate to maintain 20 ticks per second
level_settings._3: Sets the base tick rate (1 = 20 ticks per second, 2 = 10 ticks per second, etc.)
level_settings._4: Tick all players each tick even when other settings disallow this.

chunk_sending._1: Amount of chunks sent to players per tick
chunk_sending._2: Amount of chunks sent around each player
chunk_sending._3: Amount of chunks that need to be sent before spawning the player
chunk_sending._4: Save a serialized copy of the chunk in memory for faster sending
chunk_sending._5: Useful in mostly_static worlds where lots of players join at the same time

chunk_ticking._1: Max amount of chunks processed each tick
chunk_ticking._2: Radius of chunks around a player to tick

chunk_generation._1: Max. amount of chunks in the waiting queue to be generated
chunk_generation._2: Max. amount of chunks in the waiting queue to be populated

worlds._1: These settings will override the generator set in server.properties and allows loading multiple levels
